results.name: Array read by ascending antidiagonals: T(k, n) is the minimum value of the magic constant in a perimeter-magic k-gon of order n.
link: Terrel Trotter, Perimeter-Magic Polygons, Journal of Recreational Mathematics Vol. 7, No. 1, 1974, pp. 14-20 (see equations 10 and 12).
formula: T(k, n) = (n^2/2 - n + 1)*k + n/2 if n is even or both n and k are odd.
T(k, n) = (n^2/2 - n + 1)*k + (n + 1)/2) if n is odd and k is even.
